intro: Dolichandrone alternifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dolichandrone, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
